meanings.definition: A measurable substance in an organism that indicates a particular biological state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a biomarker to check the patient's health.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying different biomarkers to understand diseases better.
meanings.sent3: The biomarker jumped off the chart, surprising everyone in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a biomarker of happiness, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The glowing biomarker in the experiment made the results clear and easy to interpret.

meanings.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and evaluated as an indicator of normal biological processes, pathogenic processes, or pharmacologic responses to a therapeutic intervention.
meanings.sent1: The color change was a biomarker of the chemical reaction taking place.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are looking for new biomarkers to track the progress of the treatment.
meanings.sent3: The biomarker on the screen winked at the curious observer.
meanings.sent4: His speed on the track was a biomarker of his determination and hard work.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers served as a biomarker for the arrival of spring.
